website_summaries.verdict: A smaller, narrower bicycle seatpost meant for smaller BMX and youth bicycles needing a replacement.
pros: Narrow top tube is designed to securely hold many different seat sizes
Seatpost slides into most seat tubes with little effort and struggle
Tube diameter is good for vintage bikes as well
cons: Seatpost can get stuck inside the seat tube if inserted too far in

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Just what was needed to lower a ladies Schwinn Link bicycle. Seat was too high with factory seatpost. Near impossible to find a 1” diameter post tapered to a 7/8” seat connection point, locally. Amazon (and Wald ) comes through again. Seatpost swapped out and easily adjusts to the lower height required.
customer_reviews.author: J. Workman

customer_reviews.title: picture misleads
customer_reviews.text: it wasn't what the picture showed the shaft was smaller than the top not bigger it was a worthless buy
customer_reviews.author: AEL

customer_reviews.title: It is exactly what the description said. This allows ...
customer_reviews.text: It is exactly what the description said. This allows the bike to be used by someone taller. There isn't much else to say about this product.
customer_reviews.author: tobiwankenobi

customer_reviews.title: Not as described
customer_reviews.text: The size of this post is not as described. Bought to replace a mountain bike post lost in our move overseas and it does not fit at all.
customer_reviews.author: Ep11turbo

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I had someone steal the seat from my bike so from now on it the bike is out of sight the seat will go with me. The post is of great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Yankedog

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Thicker than stock post. I am taller and wanted my seat higher than the stock post would allow. This is a perfect fit for me.
customer_reviews.author: w.

customer_reviews.title: good quality and looks nice
customer_reviews.text: this fit perfectly for my vintage schwinn tandem bike. this size is unusual for newer bikes. I had to shop the height down to shorter length to work in my bike. good quality and looks nice.
customer_reviews.author: tater salad

customer_reviews.title: wrong post
customer_reviews.text: The wrong item was sent! The short end is suppose to be tapered smaller than the long end, this will not work with this bike. the description is correct is correct, wrong item picked!
customer_reviews.author: JRS

customer_reviews.title: This fits a 1976 Schwinn Suburban perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: This fits a 1976 Schwinn Suburban perfectly. A new seat was required and the new style seats do not fit the older seat posts. This seat post allowed me to get a newer seat for an older bike.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great post. Does not have pre drilled hole on top for seat.
customer_reviews.text: Post works great. Got it for my sons bike to extend the seat post so he can ride his bike easier. His post was really short. This fits perfect and now he can extend his legs further. Nice material. It doesn't have a hole drilled in the top for a seat, but was easily done. And was able to drill exactly for his seat. Great product at a great price!!
customer_reviews.author: Kajsa H.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap adjustability and decent looks.
customer_reviews.text: Got this post for an old J.C. Higgins bike. The original was too short for me. I only needed a couple extra inches so this did the trick. I would NOT, however, use it anywhere past half way up unless you have a sissy bar. It's not strong enough to support the rider and WILL bend (I did the research). If you only need a small boost like I did, you'll be very satisfied. The plating is decent looking and it doesn't have that super cheap china chrome look.
customer_reviews.author: J. F.

customer_reviews.title: got it for a 74 Schwinn Varsity
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up after buying an old Schwinn Varsity from a bike shop that just screamed to be ridden. After replaceing the tires, brake pads, cables, and tape, I decided I wanted a nicer seat. I decided it would be easiest to replace the post (well, than and a former owner etched their name in the post) so I went ahead and ordered this. AFAIK, this is made for Schwinn bikes only, if it isn't a Schwinn, it won't work. (I might be wrong, but Schwinns can be particular...)
customer_reviews.author: N. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement post for a modern seat on a vintage Schwinn.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect replacement post when putting a modern seat on a vintage Schwinn. Much easier than fussing with an different clamp under the seat and the larger diameter mount to the seat is probably more secure. I mounted a Brooks saddle to my 1973 Schwinn, just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Mc

customer_reviews.title: Perfect adapter
customer_reviews.text: Bike seat posts have changed a great deal in the last 45 years. The post on my 1965 Schwinn Collegiate went from 13/16 down to a tiny nub about the size of your little finger - modern seats require something much meatier. This post slid right into place and my new seat bolted right onto the now-standard 7/8 end firmly and with no issues. Problem solved!
customer_reviews.author: Mark C

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: need to return and wouldn't fit the bike I wanted to use it for.
customer_reviews.author: MARY HOFFMAN

customer_reviews.title: I had to be careful not to insert it too deep because there was no easy way to move it back up
customer_reviews.text: Hey, it is just a piece of shiny pipe. It fits my bike but it was very tight. I had to be careful not to insert it too deep because there was no easy way to move it back up.
customer_reviews.author: raven1939

customer_reviews.title: I'm disappointed the picture was very misleading
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed the picture was very misleading. After I had ordered it looked nothing like the picture. I went back to check the dimensions and the picture had changed. Just be extra sure to measure what you need so you're not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Escamilla

customer_reviews.title: Fits vintage Schwinns perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Vintage Schwinn bicycles have an uncommon seat post size. So if your original seat post looks horrible, you're out of luck. This product is a perfect replacement AND allows you to easily use modern seat clamps for aftermarket saddles.
customer_reviews.author: The Biologizer

customer_reviews.title: Just the part I needed
customer_reviews.text: Was looking everywhere for the right seatpost for my old Murray road bike. I originally bought a 7/8 seatpost until I realized it wouldn't slide in with a really big hammer. When the 13/16 seatpost arrived, it fit without issue and the raised edge for the 7/8 end also stops the seatpost from sliding all the way to the bottom. This is such a wonderful product.
customer_reviews.author: The E

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me
customer_reviews.text: Worked for what I needed,price was right,but the finish was so,so.Also where the clamp grips they have some sort of pattern stamped in the metal to make it less likely to slip.
customer_reviews.author: Rascal

customer_reviews.title: couldn't use it for the project I was working on ...
customer_reviews.text: couldn't use it for the project I was working on but will find a project that I can use it.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn P. Bunn

customer_reviews.title: Not quite the right diameter, too small
customer_reviews.text: The post I received was slightly too small (diameter) and did not fit in the bike. I had to use a shim to fill out the extra space (about 2mm)
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Shipped laaaaate; But product great!
customer_reviews.text: Took a long time for shipping. Looks like they had to manufacture it from scratch. But the product is great. Just like what was described and shown. No complaints about it.
customer_reviews.author: Harsha Hegde

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad Wald is still manufacturing non-standard hard to find parts for vintage bicycles! Thank You Wald!
customer_reviews.author: Jacques Bournel

customer_reviews.title: STEEL TUBE
customer_reviews.text: THIS THING IS A STEEL TUBE WITH A FAIRLY THICK WALL. SWAGGED ON ONE END FOR YOUR 7/8 SEAT GUTS. 13/16 FOR SCHWINN SEAT TUBE. SIGH... TYPICAL FINISH FROM WALD. THEY HAVE BEEN AROUND FOR A LONG TIME. THE 10 INCH SIZE WAS PLENTY LONG FOR MY BIKE. CHEAP. CAME FAST FROM THE FOLKS I ORDERED IT FROM. AS ALWAYS A LIGHT COAT OF MOTOR OIL WILL MAKE IT LAST LONGER. I MUST SAY THAT IF YOU SOMEHOW BEND THIS TUBE IN NORMAL USE YOU WILL NEED SOME SERIOUS HOSPITALIZATION! IT'S STEEL...
customer_reviews.author: IMHOTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: OK product, but it didn't fit on my bike ...
customer_reviews.text: OK product, but it didn't fit on my bike. this is a 25.4 seat post and my bike needs a 27.2...
customer_reviews.author: Stevie

customer_reviews.title: works as it should
customer_reviews.text: Someone borrowed the seat and seat post without my permission so I had to buy a new one. The wald 901-10 fits perfectly and appears to be good quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ace Rimmer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: Great way to get a modern seat on my wife's old Schwinn Collegiate. Worked perfectly. The 7/8" is two inches long, and the 13/16" (the part that goes in the seat post) is the long end.
customer_reviews.author: B. K. S.

customer_reviews.title: These can be hard to find.
customer_reviews.text: For those of us who enjoy old bikes, sometimes it is very difficult to fashion different saddles on them. This seat post adapts the tubing sizes for this, and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: needed a 1" X 10" post and that is what I got.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Not quite a fit
customer_reviews.text: I needed a replacement post for the Sunlite Saddle I purchased. The existing post to my Schwinn was welded to the seat assembly. The Wald post seemed to be the simplest solution, and appeared to be of the proper width. However, it was slightly narrower than the existing post, and the locking mechanism could not fully compensate for the difference. My solution was to wrap a piece of thin aluminum sheeting (for gutters, soffits, etc.) around the post, which provides enough thickness for the locking mechanism to work. So for my Schwinn, it was not quite right (but I didn't see anything else that was a guaranteed fit) but I was able to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. Kind of hard for it to not work unless it is bent , broken or trashed. I had to put more words in to the feedback.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This seat post was perfect solution for the the old JC Higgins I restored.
customer_reviews.author: jsenior biker

customer_reviews.title: The main outer diameter is 1 inch.
customer_reviews.text: The main outer diameter is 1 inch. Nowhere in the title or description it says so. It didn't fit my bike - most popular diameter these days is 1.072 inch=27.2mm.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Say whut?
customer_reviews.text: It must be okay. I don't remember ordering this one
customer_reviews.author: Tommy A. Bird

customer_reviews.title: Good value, no frills.
customer_reviews.text: The item was exactly what was advertised, a no frills bicycle seat for a good price. Make sure you take good measurements of the seat you need in order to avoid confusion. I took a guess and had to install the seat post upside down. It works great and the post is long enough to fit a variety of sizes for people.
customer_reviews.author: Gustavo R. Paredes

customer_reviews.title: 1984 Schwinn Seatpost
customer_reviews.text: Needed a replacement post for my restored 1986 Schwinn. Perfect fit and excellent finish. Plenty long enough to set the saddle to the correct height. I am 5'9" with a 30" inseam.
customer_reviews.author: kyle m arola

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy piece. Arrived exactly as it was described
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived quickly. Very sturdy piece. Arrived exactly as it was described. I ordered the wrong size, but will be reordering from them.
customer_reviews.author: Lorna Felix

customer_reviews.title: bent easily
customer_reviews.text: This seat post gave when tightening the seat and literally bent and becameout of round... seems to be cheap metal and rather flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: B. J. Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Stamped Wald 950 but did what I wanted it to.
customer_reviews.text: Another customer had pointed out that he received the Wald 950 and the ad says Wald 940. I also received the Wald 950 but it worked for my application which was to attach a Velo Webspring to an early 60's Schwinn Tiger Cruiser.
customer_reviews.author: Common Joe

customer_reviews.title: Ok but make sure it is what you need.
customer_reviews.text: The product was ok but due to the new seat not working I desired to return this item. The seller advised that I should have read the return policy before ordering this item. There was no return label supplied and seller wanted me to pay for the return.
customer_reviews.author: kmjen

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Good quality! Arrived in one piece. Works great. Haven't had any problems. It's currently on my bike. Works great! Love it! Just perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Wald Seat Post
customer_reviews.text: This seat post was exactly what I expected it to be (a normal steel seat post). It fit into the department store Schwinn that I have, which is the standard size seat post that most department store bikes have. The price was cheap.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: exactly as described, quality product. a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o p
customer_reviews.author: P. Travis

customer_reviews.title: One end is 1" and the other end is the 7/8" I actually needed
customer_reviews.text: Not being a bike mechanic, all I wanted to do was replace the bike and post that someone stole right off my bike. I bought a seat but it did not have a post. I needed a 7/8" post. This seemed to be what I needed. Or so I thought. Until I got it today and my non-mechanical eyes discovered that one end was 7/8" and the other is 1". "1 To 7/8" didn't quite get through to me. So now I'm out almost 8 bucks. And still can't use my bike. I wish this one end is 7/8" and the other is 1" was explained better in the description.
customer_reviews.author: Beans In My Ears

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't fit a 1 inch diameter on my Schwinn High Timber 2.6FS bike
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Haworth

customer_reviews.title: This did not fit my mountain bike
customer_reviews.text: This did not fit. I threw it away after wrapping tape around it to make it work. FAIL! Went into a shop and got the right seat post.
customer_reviews.author: Phylicia

product_meta.title: Wald Straight BMX Bicycle Seatpost
product_meta.description: straight post with narrower diameter Top
feature_bullets: The Package Height Of The Product Is 1 Inches
The Package Length Of The Product Is 1 Inches
The Package Width Of The Product Is 10 Inches

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
